headline.main: Drug Companies Getting F.D.A. Reprimands for False or Misleading Advertising

docs.abstract: Food and Drug Administration has repeatedly reprimanded drug makers in recent months for making false or misleading advertising claims as companies increasingly market drugs directly to consumers; most cases involve overstating benefits of drug, minimizing risks or falsely suggesting that drug is better than rival; some involve promoting drugs for unapproved uses (M)
docs.lead_paragraph: The Federal Government has repeatedly reprimanded drug companies in recent months after finding that they have made false or misleading claims in television commercials and magazine advertisements for a wide range of prescription drugs.

docs.abstract: Parental concerns about messages small children receive in G-rated animated feature films result in review showing that two-thirds of such movies produced over last 60 years include use of tobacco and alcohol by villains and heroes alike (M)
docs.lead_paragraph: Parental concerns about the messages small children receive in G-rated animated feature films have resulted in a review showing that two-thirds of such movies produced over the last 60 years include the use of tobacco and alcohol by villains and heroes alike. Dr. Adam O. Goldstein and his colleagues at the University of North Carolina School of Medicine screened 50 animated feature films by five major production companies, beginning with ''Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs,'' released in 1937, in which only a poisoned apple was consumed. They found that 34 films had at least one scene in which tobacco or alcohol was used and that the depictions did not decrease over the years.
